intro: Argentina contigua, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Argentina contigua thrives in temperate climates and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
